required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Different Montages of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation Tongue Strength
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Different Montages of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation on Tongue Strength in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: 20 healthy subjects will be split into 4 groups. Each group will receive one of the following tDCS montages : anodal, bilateral, cathodal or placebo Subjects will receive 2mA for 20 mins of their attributed tDCS. The evaluation is a maximal strength test measured with the IOPI and will take place prior to, immediately following and 30 minutes after stimulation

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 4 groups, each group receives one of three treatments or the sham treatment. Double-blinded, sham controlled, crossover study
study_design_info.masking_description: Everyone is blinded, codes are selected by a third party not involved in any step of the study

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after, and 30 minutes after tDCS
primary_outcome.description: 1 RM of tongue strength, measured using the IOPI device

arm_group.description: Anode placer over the affected primary motor cortex, cathode over contralateral supra orbital area. 2 mA, 20min stimulation
Anode placer over the affected primary motor cortex, cathode over unaffected motor cortex. 2 mA, 20min stimulation
Cathode placer over the unaffected primary motor cortex, anode over contralateral supra orbital area. 2 mA, 20min stimulation
anode montage but current is ramped up over 15 secondes, then ramped down. 2 mA, 20min stimulation

intervention.description: Subjects received a micro-current through their scalp to induce cortical and subcortical changes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- One Yes on the medium and high risk sections of the TSST (Bornheim et al.,2019)

reference.citation: Bornheim S, Croisier JL, Maquet P, Kaux JF. Proposal of a New Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation Safety Screening Tool. Am J Phys Med Rehabil. 2019 Jul;98(7):e77-e78. doi: 10.1097/PHM.0000000000001096.
